ca.ucalgary.seng301.vendingmachine

Interface IVendingMachineFactory


  • public interface IVendingMachineFactory
    This interface specifies a set of event callbacks that your vending machine implementation has to implement. The frontend calls these callbacks when the corresponding script commands are encountered.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void configure(java.util.List<java.lang.String> popNames, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> popCosts)
      Configures the current vending machine to use the indicated names and costs for the pop kinds related to the selection buttons at the indexed position.
      void construct(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> coinKinds, int selectionButtonCount)
      Constructs a vending machine that accepts a specified set of coin kinds (positive integer denominations) and a certain number of pop selection buttons.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Object> extract()
      Called to remove all coins and pops from the delivery chute of the VM, returning them in whatever order is convenient (as Integers and Pop instances).
      void insert(int value)
      Called when a coin of the specified value is inserted in the VM.
      void load(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> coinCounts, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> popCounts)
      A set of coins and a set of pops is ADDED to the current vending machine.
      void press(int value)
      Called when the specified button is pressed.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Object> unload()
      Called to remove all coins and pops from VM, returning them in the order: total unused coins as an Integer; total payment coins as an Integer; individual unused pops as Pop instances.

    • Method Detail

      • construct

        void construct(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> coinKinds,
             int selectionButtonCount)
        Constructs a vending machine that accepts a specified set of coin kinds (positive integer denominations) and a certain number of pop selection buttons. Coin kinds must have unique denominations; their order is used for later reference, but it is otherwise free. The constructed vending machine is then used for all further interactions until and unless a new vending machine is constructed. The system starts WITHOUT any vending machine constructed by default.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the coin kinds is not positive or if the selection button count is not positive
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the coin kinds do not have unique denominations

      • configure

        void configure(java.util.List<java.lang.String> popNames,
             java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> popCosts)
        Configures the current vending machine to use the indicated names and costs for the pop kinds related to the selection buttons at the indexed position. For example, the string at position 0 of popNames is to be used as the name of the pops loaded into the vending machine that would be vended by selection button 0. Pop names and pop costs DO NOT need to be unique.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are null, if the number of elements in either list is not identical to the number of selection buttons for the vending machine, if a pop name is not a string at least 1 character long, or if a pop cost is not a positive integer

      • load

        void load(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> coinCounts,
        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> popCounts)
        A set of coins and a set of pops is ADDED to the current vending machine. The two lists will indicate the number of the items of the corresponding type to be added. For example, the integer at position 0 of coinCounts will indicate how many coins of type 0 are to be added. Coin and pop types are determined at construction time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the counts are negative
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either of the arguments is null

      • unload

        java.util.List<java.lang.Object> unload()
        Called to remove all coins and pops from VM, returning them in the order: total unused coins as an Integer; total payment coins as an Integer; individual unused pops as Pop instances. Should not prevent the VM from continuing to function.

      • extract

        java.util.List<java.lang.Object> extract()
        Called to remove all coins and pops from the delivery chute of the VM, returning them in whatever order is convenient (as Integers and Pop instances). Should not prevent the VM from continuing to function.

      • insert

        void insert(int value)
        Called when a coin of the specified value is inserted in the VM.

      • press

        void press(int value)
        Called when the specified button is pressed. Buttons are numbered starting from 0. Each button corresponds to a Pop type created
        Parameters:
        value -
